source.ae39d0ef:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
source.31d95bab:
df = pd.read_csv("../input/dataregression/Position_Salaries.csv")
df.head()

data = df.iloc[:, 1:2].values
target = df.iloc[:, 2].values
source.429e5833:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
# train_test_split
train_input, valid_input, train_target, valid_target = train_test_split(data, target, test_size=0.3, shuffle=True, random_state=34)
source.3a48aee7:
from sklearn.preprocessing import PolynomialFeatures
poly = PolynomialFeatures(degree = 23)
poly.fit(train_input)
train_poly = poly.transform(train_input)

print(poly.get_feature_names())

valid_poly = poly.transform(valid_input)
source.199cebd8:
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

lr = LinearRegression()
lr.fit(train_poly,train_target)

print(lr.score(train_poly,train_target))
print(lr.score(valid_poly,valid_target))
source.3d0a5b9d:
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

ss = StandardScaler()
ss.fit(train_poly)

train_scaled = ss.transform(train_poly)
valid_scaled = ss.transform(valid_poly)
source.4050f443:
from sklearn.linear_model import Ridge

ridge = Ridge()
ridge.fit(train_scaled,train_target)


print(ridge.score(train_scaled,train_target))
print(ridge.score(valid_scaled,valid_target))
